qas.question: What was Boardwalk Hall formerly known as?
In what year did the newer Atlantic City Convention Center open?
How many sq ft of showroom space is included in the Atlantic City Convention Center?
What hotel is adjacent to the Atlantic City Convention Center?

context: Boardwalk Hall, formally known as the "<a0_0>Historic Atlantic City Convention Hall<a0_0/>", is <a1_0>an arena<a1_0/> in Atlantic City along the boardwalk. Boardwalk Hall was Atlantic City's primary convention center until the opening of the Atlantic City Convention Center in <a2_0>1997<a2_0/>. The Atlantic City Convention Center includes <a3_0>500,000 sq ft<a3_0/> (46,000 m2) of showroom space, 5 exhibit halls, 45 meeting rooms with 109,000 sq ft (10,100 m2) of space, a garage with 1,400 parking spaces, and an adjacent <a4_0>Sheraton hotel<a4_0/>. Both the Boardwalk Hall and Convention Center are operated by the Atlantic City Convention & Visitors Authority.
